intro: Turraea zenkeri, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white, fleshy flowers that resemble balls, giving it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Turraea zenkeri thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade.
